definition: to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: "I'm so glad to see you, " said Carrie, pleased and yet nonplussed.
sentences.chinese: “看见你我太高兴了，”嘉莉说，既高兴又为难。

sentences.english: LX, do you see in the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 楼下的，又看见你在上网了。

sentences.english: She gives me a big smile every time she sees me.
sentences.chinese: 她每次看见我都冲我热情地笑笑。

sentences.english: And all that dwelt at Lydda and Saron saw him, and turned to the Lord.
sentences.chinese: 凡住吕大和沙仑的人都看见了他，就归服主。

sentences.english: Who seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple asked an alms.
sentences.chinese: 他看见彼得约翰将要进殿，就求他们周济。

sentences.english: Gog saw the gun and his face went white.
sentences.chinese: 高格看见了那支枪，脸色煞白。

sentences.english: At the same moment, he perceived a pale girl standing before him.
sentences.chinese: 他看见一个面色蜡黄的姑娘站在他面前。

sentences.english: The sailors took in sail when they saw the storm approach.
sentences.chinese: 水手们看见风暴快来了，就动手收帆。

sentences.english: Sitting at his toll booth one day, the publican saw Jesus approaching.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，马太坐在税关上，看见耶稣向他走来。

sentences.english: B:Did you see his last dive?
sentences.chinese: 他的最后一次跳水你看见了吗？

sentences.english: She was found asleep on a pillow of leaves.
sentences.chinese: 有人看见她枕着树叶睡着了。

sentences.english: He saw few problems with the division of Protestants into more and smaller denominations.
sentences.chinese: 他看见几个问题与该司的新教徒更小面额的。

sentences.english: Expect to see more AI-based mobile technology quite soon.
sentences.chinese: 现在可以期待很快能看见更多的基于AI的移动技术。

sentences.english: I could see the greyish feathers of its flanks.
sentences.chinese: 我看见了它两胁间斑白的羽毛。

sentences.english: One day he sees a beautiful bell at the top of a door.
sentences.chinese: 一天，他看见一户人家的门头有个很美丽的铃铛。

definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to run into/to meet (unexpectedly)/to bump into
